intro: Erucastrum incanum var. dasycarpum, commonly known as the woolly bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, yellow flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy, grayish foliage. Its flowers bloom in early spring, and the plant produces small, round seeds within its inflated pods. It is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a characteristic species of arid and semi-arid environments.
